sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Israeli troops continue to press ahead with their offensive in the Gaza Strip on Sunday, as the humanitarian situation for Palestinians worsens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Thousands of people across Europe have been rallying against anti-Semitism under the slogan, Never Again is Now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Javier Millet was sworn in as Argentina's president, with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky present in Buenos Aires to witness the inauguration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Heavy fighting continues to rage through the Gaza Strip on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Footage released by the Israeli Defense Force shows what they say are troops fighting Hamas in Gaza City. In the southern part of the Strip in Khan Younis, Reuters reports that Israeli tanks battled their way to the center in a major new push, which is sheltering hundreds of thousands of civilians who fled other parts of the enclave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The war between Israel and Hamas is having a catastrophic impact on health in Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: WH show director general said the Palestinian territory's health system is collapsing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of Palestinians waited for hours on Sunday outside the United Nations distribution center in central Gaza to receive flour amid worsening living conditions for over 2.3 million people in the strip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: United Nations officials say there are no safe places in Gaza, nearly a week after Israel widened its offensive into the southern half of the territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Thousands of people across Europe have been rallying against anti-Semitism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Brussels, the Coordinating Committee of Jewish Organizations in Belgium organized a march gathering some 4,000 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ivo Shinsky, the president of the CCOJB, said the aim of this march is to show the Jewish community that it is not alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Berlin, numerous politicians, artists and celebrities have called for people to oppose anti-Semitism as thousands gathered in the rain under the motto Never Again Is Now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A group tracking anti-Semitism in Germany said it had documented a drastic increase in incidents in the month after the October 7 Hamas attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A total of 994 cases were reported, an increase of 320 percent compared with the same period last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: German leaders called for solidarity with Israel and with Jewish life in Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Argentina's ultra-liberal Javier Millet was sworn in as president on Sunday,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: three weeks after his election victory. The 53-year-old newcomer to the Argentine political scene vowed to honor his office with loyalty and patriotism as outgoing president Alberto Fernandez placed the presidential sash upon him after he swearing-in Millay gave his first speech as president not to the members of parliament as his tradition but at a crowd from the steps of the parliament building Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelensky was in Buenos Aires to witness the swearing-in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Zelensky spoke briefly with the Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban during his visit to the inauguration ceremony.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Zelensky phoned Milley shortly after the Argentine's electoral victory, thanking him for his clear support for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Javier Milley was sworn in as nationalist leaders and politicians looked on, including former Brazilian far-right president Jair Bolsonaro.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Following his address, Miley traveled in a convertible to the presidential palace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Later on Sunday, he is scheduled to swear in his ministers and meet with foreign dignitaries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The French government has implemented a new approach to address the homelessness situation in Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Since last spring, ten temporary shelters have been established across France in cities like Toulouse, Bordeaux and Strasbourg, aiming to relocate the homeless from the streets of the capital. pour relocer les sans-abri sur les rues du Capitale. Plus de six ans, les organisations ont envoyé un message au comité des Jeux olympiques condamnant cette stratégie de relocation comme une méthode de nettoyage social.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Ils croient que le gouvernement intègre de créer une image polonaise du Capitale avant les Jeux olympiques de Paris en 2024.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Paul Olozy, un des parlementaires du collectif d'associations, a le médical, pour le social, pour le juridique. Et donc je reviendrai à Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: En fait, c'est une politique qui avait déjà lieu, mais les JO viennent accélérer ça parce qu'il y a un impératif de faire ce qu'eux appellent une ville propre.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Et le travail de harcèlement et de nettoyage, c'est les mots du ministre de l'Intérieur.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Et donc on sait que ça s'adresse aussi aux populations que l'État considère comme indésirables.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Je suis ici dans ce qui était une fois le plus grand squat de Paris, appelé Univétum, qui a été démantelé par la police en avril.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Plus de 400 personnes, principalement de Chad et de Soudan, ont été évitées de ce site qui a été occupé pendant trois ans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: L'endroit est dit être une partie de la ville olympique pour les 24 ans de Paris Games.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Nous avons rencontré Faris, qui était un des résidents de ce squat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Nous avons eu des rencontres avec la préfecture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Il y a eu des promesses qu'on croit que les gens vont être hébergés et que tout le monde sera pris en charge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Aucune parole n'a été respectée.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Donc, toutes ces personnes se sont retrouvées à la rue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Je pense que les réfugiés sont une mauvaise image pour le géo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: C'est pourquoi ils ont décidé d'expulser.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Sauf qu'il n'y a pas eu de solution pour ces personnes qui sont expulsées des squats.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: D'autres chalets pour les sans-abri dans la ville ressentent aussi la pression, car ils sont locés dans des zones désignées comme des sites de jeu olympique.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Les personnes qui vivent à la rue, et notamment les publics exilés, sont chassés de plus en plus loin de Paris. On nous fait remonter régulièrement que les personnes sont réveillées la nuit et qu'on leur demande de partir.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Une de nos craintes, c'est les difficultés que les personnes vont rencontrer pendant les Jeux olympiques pour pouvoir se déplacer et pour pouvoir accéder à certains lieux de répit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Le Paris-Ville de France préfecture a filmé à Euronews their commitment to getting these individuals off the streets, Olympics or not, with the aim of securing more dignified accommodation for them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: These people face a precarious situation as they are compelled to attend interviews with the prefecture of Paris, a potentially dangerous process for the migrants lacking a legal status which could lead to the expulsion from the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: lack in a legal status which could lead to the expulsion from the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Along the east coast of England, people's homes are disappearing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The relentless force of the sea causing rapid coastal erosion at an accelerating and alarming pace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It was like two or three roads.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: You'd have to go up and down the dunes two or three times to actually get to the sea from here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And there's that amount that's gone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And now we're just a few metres away.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Yeah.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: An increase in storm surges, intensified by increasingly erratic weather patterns, are devastating the sandy cliffs along this coastal stretch.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Metres of land recently plunged over the edge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The local council now poised to dismantle the newly abandoned homes closest to the cliffside of this sea-battered village.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: This is somebody's driveway and until very recently it led to a road that connected to homes along this beachfront.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But now that road is on the beach.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: These homes are just metres away from the same fate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Local people say coastal erosion is speeding up rapidly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It is climate change itself that's what's going to tear not only this nation apart, but many others.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And those that are able to survive it will be those that have organised for it now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Experts are warning local governments and nations must brace for the challenges ahead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Over time, those storms will be more extreme in line with the changes that we expect with climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: So we need to be prepared for that and we need to understand how to prepare communities in the long run to be able to be resilient and withstand those kind of events.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Coastal communities across Europe face an uncertain future as climate change speeds up erosion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Luke Hanrahan, Euronews, Norfolk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The children of an imprisoned Iranian activist have accepted this year's Nobel Peace Prize on her behalf in a ceremony Sunday in Oslo, Norway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Nagesh Mohammadi is renowned for campaigning for women's rights and democracy in her country, as well as fighting against the death penalty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: penalty. This year's Peace Prize recognizes the brave women in Iran and around the world who fight for basic human rights and for an end to the discrimination and against segregation of women. Mohammadi has been detained since 2021 in even prison in Tehran.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Her children lost her seven years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: She is the 19th woman to win the Nobel Peace Prize and it's the fifth time that it has been given to someone who is in prison or under house arrest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It was the French film Anatomie of a fall by Justine Trillet that swept the board at the European Film Awards in Berlin, which have rewarded the best European films each year since 1988.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The film won the Best Screenplay, Best Director and Best Film Awards, as well as the Best Actress prize for Sandra Hula.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It's another jewel in the crown for the film which won the Palme d'Or at this year's film festival in Cannes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's the story of a woman who has to deal with the suspicious death of her husband for which she is accused.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Through the investigation and the ensuing trial, Justine Trillet delivers a veritable dissection of the couple's relationship, magnificently played by the German actress Sandra Hula, Grâce à l'investigation et le trial, Justine Trillet délivre une véritable dissension de la relation des couples, magnifiquement jouée par la chambre allemande, Sandra Woller, amusée par le film.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Un film, évidemment, c'est un scénario, c'est des plans, des caméras, mais c'est surtout 80% des acteurs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Sandra, c'est vrai que ça a été une surprise chaque jour de moi, mais aussi de toute l'équipe, de constater à quel point elle était dans la générosité, dans une implication que j'ai rarement vue sur un film.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Et donc voilà, je lui dois évidemment ce film, d'une certaine façon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: D'autres films dans la compétition incluaient Jonathan Glazer's The Zone of Interest, Agnieszka's Holland's Green Border, Mathieu Garoni's Me Captain et Aki Kurismaki's Fallen Leaves, tous ceux qui ont pu faire la même chose, malgré leur qualité.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: La 36e cérémonie des European Film Awards a montré toute la richesse, la diversité et la pertinence des cinémas européens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Avec cette année, une compétition particulièrement relevée et des films qui prennent en temps réel le pouls de l'Europe et du monde.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Des films particulièrement sensibles et engagés qui nous permettent de mieux comprendre notre humanité et ses nombreuses failles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A Berlin, Frédéric Ponsard pour Euronews.
